The project involves testing updates, new features, mostly on VR headsets but may also include testing on web and desktop apps. The candidate will need to have good exploratory skills and an inquisitive mind to test the limitations of the software, hardware and raise bugs. They will also have to document and create test reports and be comfortable with team collaboration.

QA Testers are expected to be capable of functioning independently or as part of a team, analysing and isolating software and hardware failures, and reporting thorough, actionable bugs.

1+ year of testing or related experience OR

A recent University Degree

Execution of Test Cases

Functional testing of Devices by using them

Support Technical Team

Organizing Events

Troubleshooting Devices

Reporting Inventory

Why Qualitest?

Founded in 1997, Qualitest offers a wide range of digital quality solutions designed to provide enterprise customers with end-to-end quality management services across the software lifecycle. Qualitest achieves this by deploying engagement models tailored to the precise quality engineering needs of technology platforms in the financial services, health services, telecom, technology, retail, media, gaming, and utilities industries. It has operations in the US, UK, India, Germany, Romania, Israel, Argentina, Mexico, Switzerland, and Portugal, and serves over 400 blue-chip customers worldwide.

We provide industry-leading managed services that drive Quality for Quality Assurance and Testing of hardware devices, software apps and experiences as well as Ground Truth Data Services for artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML)

Be a part of a company who strives to support for diversity and inclusion in the workplace – we are one, we are many at Qualitest. Celebrate culture, share knowledge with engineers from around the globe, and inspire each other through our differences. We have more than 40% women and around 120 different nationalities.

Local and global opportunities – we offer you internal rotation and international mobility opportunities to grow your career.

Clear view of your career and progression with the company – Qualitest is growing massively (since 2021 – tripled our employees base – we now have more than 8,000 engineers) and giving you the opportunity to grow with us.

Work hard and play harder with our flexible and casual culture. Take a break from work and join an employee event, or enjoy the amenities and games provided from one of our Employees Centers.

Never stop experimenting and learning with QCraft – our Learning & Development platform: 50,000+ courses, 300+ virtual labs, mentorship and leadership programs, professional tribes, sponsored certifications, and much more

Earn bonuses via our Client Referral and Employee Referral Program’s. Refer and earn – tap your network for net-worth.

We recognize our employees work via our Qudos platform - You can earn bonuses and spot awards by celebrating your and your peers’ achievements.

A Competitive pay, the salary range for the role is $41,600.

Save your earnings and prepare for your future by enrolling in our 401k plan where Qualitest will match your contributions accelerating your savings plan.

Life and disability insurance.

Take care of your health with enrollment into one of our competitive healthcare benefits.

Report this job


          This is a remote position.

What You'll Do:

Partner with cross-functional teams to gain a deep understanding of software requirements and specifications.

Craft and execute comprehensive test plans, test cases, and scripts to rigorously evaluate software functionality.

Utilize your sharp eye to identify, document, and track software defects using bug-tracking tools.

Conduct thorough regression testing to validate fixes and maintain a high standard of quality.

Assist in automating test scripts to enhance efficiency and streamline the testing process.

Perform exploratory testing to uncover potential issues and usability concerns that might be missed by traditional methods.

Work hand-in-hand with developers to effectively communicate issues and ensure successful bug fixes.

Provide timely and insightful reports on testing progress and results, keeping stakeholders informed.

Proactively contribute to the continuous improvement of our QA processes and methodologies.

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience).

A strong dedication to software quality assurance and a desire to continuously learn and grow.

Solid understanding of software testing concepts, methodologies, and best practices.

Familiarity with basic programming languages and scripting (e.g., Java, Python) is a plus.

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills to diagnose and resolve complex issues.

A detail-oriented mindset with the ability to identify inconsistencies and potential defects.

Effective communication skills and a collaborative approach to working within a team environment.

Prior experience with testing tools and bug-tracking systems is a plus.

Prior experience with testing tools and bug-tracking systems is a plus.

Report this job

We are a diverse and passionate team of event experts and fans who are dedicated to helping organizers transform their event experiences. Like our clients, we live and breathe events. We take our passion, knowledge, and hands-on experience and apply it to our work every single day. With offices in Dallas, Montreal, and Sydney, and an expansive remote workforce across the globe, our diverse backgrounds give us the experience needed to create incredible events for any industry, anywhere in the world.

Leap Event Technology is recognized and certified as a Top Workplace and Great Place to Work Canada.

We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Junior Software Quality Assurance Analyst to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will contribute to ensuring the quality and reliability of our software products through comprehensive testing methodologies.

You will be responsible for testing Live Event Ticketing and Content Management System platforms in an Agile environment. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to uphold the highest standards of software excellence. Your dedication to learning and willingness to explore automated testing will contribute to the continuous improvement of our testing processes.

This is an excellent opportunity for an individual looking to kick-start their career in the field of quality assurance.

Sounds interesting? Let’s talk.

Collaborate with Product and Engineering teams to understand software requirements and functionality.

Participate in Scrum meetings, providing insights from a QA perspective to enhance overall product quality.

Create and execute manual test cases to identify software defects and inconsistencies.

Validate data integrity, system compatibility, and synchronization across integrated components.

Perform functional, regression, and sanity testing to ensure the reliability and stability of the application.

Report and document defects with clear and replicable steps for easy issue resolution.

Assist in maintaining and updating test documentation, including test plans and test cases.

Participate in the continuous improvement of QA processes and methodologies.

Contribute to the identification and implementation of test automation opportunities.

Communicate effectively with team members to ensure a clear understanding of testing goals and outcomes.

Opportunity to gain hands-on experience in a dynamic QA environment.

Access to continuous learning and growth opportunities, including exposure to automated testing techniques.

Competitive salary and benefits package.

Opportunity for career growth and skill development.

Exposure to diverse projects and technologies.

Collaborative and supportive work environment.

If you don’t live near an office but happen to be visiting nearby, you can work from the office for as long as you need.

Leap Event Technology provides equal opportunity to qualified persons regardless of race, color, sex, religion, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status, or other categories protected by law.

Bachelor's degree in a technology-related field or equivalent practical experience.

Strong passion for software quality assurance and a keen eye for detail.

Basic understanding of fundamental software testing principles and methodologies.

Familiarity with various manual testing techniques and processes.

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.

Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.

Willingness to learn and adapt to automated testing practices.

Basic understanding of programming concepts and scripting languages.

Prior exposure to testing tools and technologies is advantageous.

Enthusiasm for learning and adapting to new technologies and methodologies.

Strong organizational skills and ability to manage time effectively to meet deadlines while handling multiple tasks.

Ability to work both collaboratively and independently, demonstrating initiative and self-motivation.

Experience with testing tools such as TestRail for test case management, and Jira for issue tracking.

Exposure to Selenium or any other test automation tools.

Basic knowledge of PHP or equivalent web development frameworks.

Experience working with e-commerce platforms or content management systems.

Experience working independently as the sole QA on a development team.

Passion for live events!

Responsibilities:

[Company Name] is a dynamic and innovative tech company specializing in [brief description of company focus or industry]. We are committed to delivering cutting-edge solutions that empower businesses to thrive in today's rapidly evolving digital landscape.

Job Description:

We are seeking a skilled Integration Test Engineer with a minimum of 3 years of experience in testing major application integrations or product releases. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in writing automated tests for .NET using XUnit or similar testing tools.

Key Responsibilities:

Test major application integrations and product releases to ensure seamless functionality and compatibility.

Develop and maintain automated tests for .NET applications using XUnit or similar testing frameworks.

Collaborate closely with development teams to identify and address bugs, defects, and performance issues.

Work in a fast-paced environment while adhering to standards and best practices.

Demonstrate excellent organizational, analytical, and problem-solving skills.

Communicate effectively with team members and stakeholders through proficient written and verbal skills.

Balance independent work with effective collaboration within a team environment.

Embrace constructive criticism and proactively seek opportunities for improvement.

Qualifications:

3+ years of experience testing major application integrations or product releases.

1+ years of experience writing automated tests for .NET using XUnit or similar testing tools.

Proven ability to work in a fast-paced environment while maintaining adherence to standards and best practices.

Strong organizational, analytical, and problem-solving skills.

Proficient written and verbal communication skills.

Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.

Willingness to accept constructive criticism and incorporate suggestions and feedback.

Glory Grace B.

Glory Grace B.

Resource Manager at Bayforce

NO C2C CANDIDATES NO SPONSORSHIP

MUST BE WILLING TO RELOCATE OR CURRENTLY IN ILLINOIS

Job Summary:

We are looking for a meticulous QA Tester to contribute to the high standards of software quality and reliability that our healthcare products demand. As a QA Tester , you will be part of a dynamic team that ensures our software applications meet our stringent specifications and customer expectations through detailed testing, documentation, and continuous improvement processes.

Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and execute test cases to validate new software products and updates.

Identify, record, and track bugs systematically.

Collaborate closely with development teams to resolve any issues in a timely manner.

Maintain and update testing and defect logs.

Engage in continuous improvement activities to enhance testing efficiency and effectiveness.

Prepare and present reports and metrics to Senior Management regarding testing progress and project status.

Work within regulatory standards, including compliance with FDA regulations for software testing in a medical context.

Participate in product design reviews to provide input on functional requirements, product designs, schedules, or potential problems.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.

3+ years of experience in software QA testing.

Strong understanding of QA methodologies, tools, and processes.

Experience in writing clear, concise, and comprehensive test plans and test cases.

Hands-on experience with both white box and black box testing.

Experience with automated testing tools is a plus.

Ability to understand and create test plans from specifications or verbal communications.

Knowledge of SQL and scripting is an advantage.

Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

Good communication skills and the ability to work within a team.

Seniority level
          
          
            Mid-Senior level

            Contract

Industries
            
            
            Medical Equipment Manufacturing, Manufacturing, and Pharmaceutical Manufacturing

Determine the total breadth and depth of testing required for a given feature when developing test cases, in order to ensure that the products will meet company quality standards when released

Perform testing activities including functional, regression, and performance testing

Design, develop, and maintain test cases

Review test results and properly evaluate the stability of the software being tested

Set up test environments with the necessary test data and execute detailed test procedures and test cases for assigned products or product modules

Analyze and report test results to product teams

Log defects and track them to resolution

Package and support deployment of builds and releases

Work effectively with Developers, Product Management, Operations, and other teams as needed

Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience.

3+ years of experience with Jira environments.

Ability to develop test cases independently to support deliverables

3+ years of proven experience with test planning, executing test cases, and performing validation activities

3+ years of experience developing test scripts, and performing front and back-end test validation

Applicants must be a US citizen and either have active clearance or obtain a clearance due to the role.

This is a two month contract remote role.

OMS testing knowledge for 3-4 yrs is a Must have and IBM Sterling OMS is a Nice to have.

Integration layer testing knowledge is a Must, Preferably MuleSoft/Microservice.

Having experience performing SFCC backend testing.

Agile methodologies, Testing techniques and practices.

Test management tools JIRA, Testrail will be nice to have.

Lead QA spokesperson on communicating the status of the sprint story in Standups.

Communicate and engage with Project teams, keeping them informed on Delivery activities, timelines and blockers.

Understanding and defining areas to calculate the overall risk of the project.

Formulate and facilitate the UAT Strategy as needed in the nature of the Project.

Ensuring entry, exit criteria, Defect Prioritization and SLA’s with 3rd party Teams are aligned and met accordingly.

Facilitate Defect/Bug triage with cross teams when any blockers are open and escalated as appropriate to keep the work progressing.

Publish Daily and Weekly Status report.

Ensure to be on standby for support during Production Sev 1/Sev 2 issues

To own continual process improvement exists within the team to ensure Quality is adhered during testing and validation processes.

OMS testing knowledge for 3-4 years.

Integration layer testing knowledge.

SFCC backend testing experience.

Job Title: Lead Automated and Manual Tester (Remote)

Location: Northeast , OH (Fully Remote)

Preference is for someone local to Ohio.

Experience working in non-profit Christian environment is required

Position Overview:

We are seeking a skilled Lead Automated and Manual Tester to join the team. In this role, you will be responsible for leading our testing efforts, utilizing both automated and manual testing methodologies. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in scripting, particularly in .NET and/or C#, and possess the ability to write and execute tests effectively. This role offers the opportunity to take ownership of testing processes, develop and implement testing strategies, and drive the overall quality of our products.

Responsibilities:

Lead the testing efforts, including both automated and manual testing processes.

Develop and implement testing strategies to ensure product quality and reliability.

Write, execute, and maintain automated test scripts using .NET and/or C#.

Design and execute manual test cases to validate software functionality.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify testing requirements and ensure comprehensive test coverage.

Mentor and provide guidance to junior members of the testing team.

Stay updated on industry best practices and emerging technologies in software testing.

Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.

Proven experience in automated and manual testing methodologies.

Strong scripting experience in .NET and/or C#.

Experience with testing frameworks such as Selenium, NUnit, or similar tools.

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.

Ability to work independently and in a team environment.

Strong communication and leadership abilities.

US Citizen or legally authorized to work in the United States.

Benefits:

Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package.

Flexible remote work options.

Opportunity for professional growth and advancement.

Collaborative and supportive work environment.

Impactful work contributing to the improvement of healthcare technology.

Interested in the role?: Send inquiries, resumes to john@emeraldresourcegroup.com.

HireCapital provided pay range

Base pay range

$90,000.00/yr - $110,000.00/yr

Job Title: QA Analyst

Location: Remote, EST/CST time zones preferred

Job Type: Permanent

Compensation: $90-110k with excellent benefits

Job Description:

HireCapital is partnered directly with the Chief Technology Officer at an organization in an industry that affects a supply chain the U.S. relies on every day. This is a chance to digitize a traditionally manual industry while also protecting its members from attacks in a digital era. This position presents an opportunity to lead software quality assurance efforts, mentoring and guiding team members, to help shape the future of QA processes within the organization. This role is fully remote with supportive leadership and growth opportunities.

Key Responsibilities:

Develop and execute test plans based on project requirements.

Conduct functional, regression, integration, and performance testing.

Create and maintain automated test scripts.

Identify and track software defects, collaborating on solutions.

Communicate effectively with cross-functional teams.

Document test plans, cases, and results.

Contribute to QA process improvement.

Participate in code reviews and regression testing.

Mentor team members on QA best practices.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field.

5+ years of experience in Software QA or similar role.

Proficiency in testing tools and methodologies.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.

Detail-oriented with a commitment to quality.

Additional Information:

Familiarity with Jira, C#, Angular 17, and Azure preferred.

Knowledge of unit testing and load testing.

Experience with automation testing tools.

Please note that for this position, we will only be considering direct applicants and will not be engaging with third-party agencies or intermediaries.

HireCapital and our clients are equal-opportunity employers. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Oracle 11.2g, Business Objects 11 w/Crystal, EMC documentum, Unix/Linux/Window environment, HP LoadRunner, QTP, HP UFT, HP ALM

To meet the requirements of legislation legalizing adult-use recreational cannabis, as part of a collective effort carried out by DOH, ITS, and the new Office of Cannabis Management, the scope of this project is to implement an online licensing Portal utilizing existing NYBE framework and back office for OCM, which will provide licensing for marijuana producers, distributors, retailers, and other actors in the cannabis market

Conducts automated and manual tests to ensure that the software created/upgraded performs as necessary and meets the user requirements. Develops and maintains user and technical documentation and project process documentation for application teams. Understands the view of applications and/or technology and is able to put procedures in a logical sequence

This position will require the Tester Expert to perform multiple types of mission critical system application testing for the Cannabis Licensing System (including but not limited to system, end-to-end, automated, performance, smoke, regression, black box, white box, and usability) to ensure the quality of the system being developed for OCM

Work directly with business analysts, program subject matter experts and technical staff to create robust test plans in HP ALM for web applications

Perform testing (System, End-to-End Integration, Automated, Performance, Smoke, Black Box, White Box, Usability, and Fail-Over tests), including troubleshooting and issue resolution

Work with automation testing HP UFT, QTP (Quick Test Pro), and/or Win Runner; recording and scripting automated functional tests; lead in building UFT automated Scripting Framework for NYBE application

Perform application testing based on written test scripts; create, manage and execute functional test and regression test scripts. Document, track, research, test, and communicate defects using HP ALM. Write and execute test plans in HP ALM

Perform software Black Box and White Box testing and debugging in different phases of software development life cycle

Develop scripts for Regression Testing Automation tools and Performance Testing Automation tools

Work with performance testing tools like Load Runner, Astra Load Test to perform load, performance, and break testing

Develop generic reusable functions and scripts

Providing mission critical applications support and being on call as required

Developing an understanding of Java code, VB Script, review and debugging issues

Possessing an understanding of programming languages PL/SQL, SQL, Java, VB, .Net, HTML, TSL, PHP, VB Script

Thorough understanding of NYS New York Business Express system and gaining expertise to provide support

Working creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment

Participate in technical meetings and support calls

oakw2dvBVM

DataStaff, Inc. is seeking a Software Tester/QA Analyst for a long-term contract opportunity with one of our direct clients in Richmond, VA.

Hybrid work schedule, 3 days per week will be onsite.

Job Description:

The Software QA team is hiring an experienced, highly motivated QA analyst who will participate in an agile team comprising the client’s team and third-party team members. This team is charged with developing an Agency Grant Management System using the Microsoft Dynamics platform.

Responsibilities:

Test software releases and provide input on appropriate release schedule(s)

Fully participate in agile development process, including requirements gathering, business analysis, stakeholder interview, development discussions, all required standups, etc.

Fully document all test cases, scripts, and other artifacts created

Participate, as this project allows, in other testing activities underway

Required Skills:

5 Years - Software QA Testing

3 Years - Agile Development or Testing

2 Years - Microsoft Dynamics

Desired Skills:

5 Years - Business Analysis

5 Years - Federal or State Grant Management

3 Years - Financial Management

This position is available on a corp-to-corp basis or as a W2 position with competitive benefits package. DataStaff, Inc. offers medical, dental, and vision coverage options as well as paid vacation, sick, and holiday leave. As many of our positions are long-term, we also have a 401k program available for employees after 6 months.
